Title: 🖼 -Come, we will crucify you-. A family of Russian oppositionist...
Description: -Come, we will crucify you.- A family of Russian oppositionists with five children is being deported from SwedenOlga Rogachevskikh, a chemist from Yekaterinburg, together with her husband Alexei and five children, the youngest of whom is now only six years old, left Russia after the start of the war. They publicly expressed their anti-war point of view, which caused them problems at work. -I am a pacifist and generally do not accept any military conflicts, much less attacks on the fraternal people, because every Russian has close and distant relatives in Ukraine. After the war, we were in a very stressful state, and we decided to leave, because we can’t change anything in Russia,- Olga told ASTRA.According to her, Sweden was the only country where where they could most quickly obtain visas and enter legally. In June 2022, they crossed the border and applied for asylum. A few months later, immediately after mobilization began, they received a refusal. Olga and her husband filed an appeal, which was considered for another six months.-In fact, migration clerks do not have a document by which they should evaluate Russians who opposed the war. In fact, they rely on outdated documents, according to which there is no war,- Olga claims.Olga says that she and her husband still found a way to suspend the decision on their deportation, but after 11 months they anyway, an order was issued to leave the country.-On August 1, I was absolutely illegally put in a pre-trial detention center. I am an asylum seeker, all my documents are legal, but since then they have not released me. I lived in migration housing, came and renewed my asylum seeker card. I was where I was supposed to be. If they suspected that I would run away, they should have forced me to report to come. But they missed this point and simply arrested me, separating me from my five children,- Olga told ASTRA.A review of the decision to place her in a pre-trial detention center in early October did not yield anything. i>-I am in the leaked FSB database -Oppositionists- because I have a small journalistic job. I wrote articles about anti-war organizations that are banned in Russia. I took part in rallies and demonstrations, wrote a book, and ran a telegram channel in which I told how to get asylum. Provocateurs are writing to my husband from the FSB,- Olga shares.She says what she saw asylum seekers from Belarus were deportedagainst whom criminal proceedings were initiated. According to Olga, the son from this family was arrested immediately at the border, and his mother stopped communicating. -I am now simply afraid for my life, because the latest paper says that nothing threatens us, there is no war in Yekaterinburg, everything is fine, the FSB will not touch us. And my interview was published on YouTube, there were 1100 comments. 80 percent of them - come, we will crucify you,- says Olga.Olga has now created petition asking the Swedish authorities to prevent her deportation. Scandinavian countries have repeatedly denied political asylum to Russians. So, Russian Pavel Suetin left Severomorsk for Norway and requested asylum in the city of Vadsø, but in September 2024, the Norwegian migration department informed him that he was not entitled to asylum and must leave the Schengen zone within three weeks. Another Russian, Stanislav Brysin, was refused asylum in Sweden, despite the experience of holding protests and an open criminal case for -calls for terrorism.- ASTRA wrote that in search of refuge, Brysin boarded a boat and sailed towards Ireland. Before this Sweden has deported a family from Belarus, against whom a criminal case has been opened in their homeland. Not The situation with asylums in the USA is better. So, in material about American migration prisons ASTRA told the story of an opposition journalist from Russia with administrative punishment for -discrediting the army-, which US authorities deported to their homeland and handed over to the FSB.🌱 Subscribe to ASTRA. Title: 🖼 Russia is deceitfully recruiting young girls from Africa, Asia...
Description: Russia is deceiving young girls from Africa, Asia and Latin America to assemble Shaheds - Associated PressAbout 200 foreign women are assembling Iranian drones in the Alabuga special economic zone in Tatarstan. Girls aged 18–22 are attracted to Russia using the Alabuga Start online program: on the program’s website they are promised studies in Europe, a free plane and work in the service and catering sectors, but this turns out to be a hoax. As a result, girls face constant monitoring, broken wage promises, and dangerous work with caustic chemicals that damage their skin. -I regret and curse the day when I started doing this,- the publication quotes one of the women. Together with foreign women, 15-16-year-old Russian students of vocational schools work there, who also complain about working conditions. Analysts found that since July 29, about 95% of drones have not hit any visible targets in Ukraine. Instead, they fall into the rivers and fields of Ukraine, fly into Latvia and land on the territory of Russia or Belarus. Until July, about 14% of Shaheds hit targets in Ukraine. The publication writes that one of the reasons for the decline in the quality of drones may be unskilled labor. The special economic zone -Alabuga- was created in 2006 to attract business and investment to Tatarstan. After February 2022, it quickly grew and its parts switched to military production.

Title: 🖼 Amendments were introduced to the State Duma, according to whi...
Description: The State Duma has introduced amendments according to which foreign citizenship will become an aggravating circumstance when committing a crimeDraft amendments to Part 1 of Article 63 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (-Circumstances- aggravating punishment-) was introduced to the State Duma by deputy Evgeniy Marchenko (non-factional parliamentarian). He proposes to consider the commission of a crime -by a person with foreign citizenship or a stateless person- as an aggravating circumstance, writes -Kommersant-. Marchenko believes that this initiative -will become an effective preventive mechanism- and will contribute to -more responsible behavior- of foreigners in the Russian Federation. He refers to TFR statistics indicating a 55% increase in the number of extremist crimes committed by migrants in the first half of 2024. Experts interviewed by Kommersant say these amendments contradict the constitutional principle of equality before the law and may contribute to the outflow of migrants. The State Duma is currently considering several bills that would tighten migration policy: illegal stay in the country as an aggravating circumstance when sentencing, and equating the organization of illegal migration to particularly serious crimes. State Duma Speaker Vyacheslav Volodin called tightening control over migration a priority for the State Duma this session.  Until 2021, Marchenko was a deputy from United Russia, but was later expelled from the party because the parliamentarian, contrary to the consolidated decision of the party bodies, voted against the adoption of the federal budget in the first reading, thereby violating the norms of the charter -United Russia- and regulations on the faction.

Title: 🎬🖼 A cargo ship with 20 thousand tons of saltpeter from Russia ...
Description: A cargo ship with 20 thousand tons of saltpeter from Russia has not been able to get up for repairs in Europe for more than a month. Local authorities fear a repeat of the tragedy in Beirut The Malta-flagged cargo ship MV Ruby carrying Russian fertilizers has not been allowed into European ports for repairs since the beginning of September. European authorities are afraid of the possible detonation of 20 thousand tons of ammonium nitrate (ammonium nitrate), which Ruby was supposed to deliver to Africa from the Murmansk region. The New York Times writes about this.Ruby left the port in the city of Kandalaksha in August. Soon after the start of the journey, the ship ran aground, resulting in damage to the hull, propeller and rudder. From September 1 to September 4, the ship was in the Norwegian port of Tromso - there it was inspected, but not repaired. Since then, the ship has not been allowed to dock.Ammonium nitrate is a popular fertilizer that comes with risks. Nitrate is explosive, especially in large quantities. Heating or, for example, a significant change in air humidity can lead to an explosion. In August 2020, due to welding work in the port of Lebanese Beirut, 2,750 tons of saltpeter detonated - as a result of a powerful explosion (on video), more than 200 people were killed, and about 300,000 more were left homeless. There is about 8 times more saltpeter on board Ruby - although it is known that the ship was not damaged by the cargo. The opportunity to moor the ship with explosive cargo MV Ruby has already been denied by the authorities of Lithuania and Great Britain, off whose coast the ship has been docking for the last week. Now the UAE company that operates the vessel, Serenity Shipping, has requested permission to dock to unload fertilizer onto another vessel and carry out repairs on the Ruby. Even Malta refused to allow Ruby with explosive cargo, writes The New York Times. This is despite the fact that the ship is flying the Maltese flag. Officials said the Ruby would only be able to dock if it got rid of the saltpeter. Title: 🎬🖼 Security forces disrupt the concerts of the Russian rock ban...
Description: For the second day in a row, security forces disrupt the concerts of the Russian rock band Otto Dix Yesterday the concert was supposed to take place in Yaroslavl, and today in Nizhny Novgorod. However, the musicians are not allowed to play the program to the end. Eyewitnesses say that today riot police burst onto the stage and laid lead singer Michael Drau face down on the floor. Then they began checking the spectators' documents. -If we didn’t have a passport with us, then we were checked through government services,- Sergei told ASTRA. Another concert participant reported that the employees forbade calling or filming anything on their phones, and also thoroughly checked everyone’s bags. In addition, people were asked what their job was and the purpose of attending the concert was clarified. -But they themselves didn’t explain anything!- – she added. Some spectators were released, but several were loaded into paddy wagons. The exact number of detainees is currently unknown. -They said they would take me to the department. They said something about preventative drug testing,- said another girl. The musicians themselves have not yet commented on the news. Some fans of the group believe that the cancellation of concerts may be due to -LGBT propaganda.- According to unconfirmed rumors, Otto Dix's lead singer, Michael Drau, was formerly a woman named Marina who underwent hormone therapy. However, the fan club has not yet come to a consensus whether this is true or not.☮️ Even the most minimal, but regular donations from readers are important to continue the work of ASTRA: Patreon Boosty Crypto BuyMeACoffee

Title: The Supreme Court revoked the license of the Saratov media outlet...
Description: The Supreme Court revoked the license of the Saratov media outlet Svobodnye Novosti. FreeNews-Volga-Occasion there is no marking of -foreign agents- on the names of Dmitry Muratov and Andrei Illarionov. At the trial, the publication stated that in the article where Illarionov appeared, the journalists referred to the RBC website, where the economist’s name was also presented without the -foreign agent- tag. In addition, Denis Rudenko, a representative of the Energia publishing house, noted that the work of Roskomnadzor and judicial practice know examples when, even after four warnings received in a year, media activities in Russia did not stop. However, the judge announced that Roskomnadzor's claim was fully satisfied.In April, Roskomnadzor blocked the Svobodnye Novosti website. It is alleged that the publication -repeatedly posted -unreliable socially significant information aimed at destabilizing the socio-political situation- in Russia. The list included articles about the death of Alexei Navalny, rallies in memory of Boris Nemtsov and the participation of Boris Nadezhdin in the presidential elections.

Title: 🖼 Andrei Turchak appointed a senator from the Republic of Altai,...
Description: Andrey Turchak appointed a -veteran of the Northern Military District- as senator from the Altai RepublicAmyr Argamakov, a 30-year-old participant in the war with Ukraine has the rank of guard major. In 2024, Vladimir Putin awarded him the title of Hero of Russia. Amyr previously took part in hostilities in Syria. Argamakov became the third participant in the war to be appointed as a representative of the region in the Federation Council. Prior to this, Yuri Nimchenko was appointed senator from the annexed Crimea, and Alexey Kondratyev from the Kursk region.
